meanings.definition: A device that converts alternating current into direct current.
meanings.sent1: The rectifier changed the electricity from wiggly to straight.
meanings.sent2: The rectifier in the power supply ensures our devices get the right type of current.
meanings.sent3: The silly rectifier thought it could turn circles into lines!
meanings.sent4: She was a human rectifier, always smoothing out the bumps in their plans.
meanings.sent5: The little machine hummed as it transformed the current, like a magic wand turning chaos into order.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that corrects or removes faults.
meanings.sent1: The teacher acted as a rectifier, helping students fix their mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was the rectifier of all car troubles in the town.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy saw himself as the family's official rectifier of spilled snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a rectifier, smoothing over any awkward moments in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: He was like a walking rectifier, always ready to make things right in any situation.
